Apsara Capital is the only investment firm in the UK focusing exclusively on the water sector. We are looking for a junior data scientist to join our London office and assist us in deepening our analysis of the water industry. The candidate's main responsibilities will be to identify, collect, structure, and analyse sector-related data.


Skills & Requirements


Minimum of an MSc in Data Science or a related field


Two years work experience


Excellent working knowledge of Python, R, and/or MATLAB, as well as visualisation tools


Experience with web-scraping


Familiarity with a variety of statistical methods and machine learning concepts


Demonstrated ability to manipulate large data sets


Excellent written and verbal communication skills

As a startup with significant funding, we are seeking a dedicated Data Scientist who is ready to shake the publishing industry and work on the next best-seller prediction algorithm.


You are/have:



  • An enthusiastic reader

  • Excited about discovering future bestsellers

  • Strong mathematical background

  • Advanced knowledge in one of the following programming languages: R / Python

  • Not afraid of writing complex SQL queries

  • Some knowledge in Node JS / Ruby would be a plus

  • Startup experience is a clear plus


You will be responsible for:


Developing and testing models for predicting future best-sellers


What we are offering:



  • Your compensation will include meaningful equity ownership.

  • An inspirational startup environment in our office in the heart of Berlin

  • A dedicated team

  • A unique opportunity: take responsibility for and implement your own ideas in a fast-growing, dynamic company


Do you want to build the world's biggest data-driven publishing house with us?

Big Data Architect (w/m)


Wir suchen die besten Big Data Architecten (w/m) von morgen für unser Business Intelligence Competence Center in Coburg.


Mit Hilfe von Big-Data-Technologien bringen wir Daten jetzt richtig groß raus und eröffnen eine faszi­nierende Welt unge­nutzter Daten­potenziale. Für Themen, mit denen wir die Zukunft gestalten. In einem Unternehmen, das heute an den Lösungen von morgen arbeitet. Dafür lassen wir Maschinen lernen, Computer verstehen und bringen kreativ unsere Intelligenz zum Einsatz. Unter­stützen Sie uns dabei! Mit Ihrem Können, Ihren Ideen und Ihrer Begeisterung stellen wir Daten in den Mittel­punkt und lassen Neues daraus entstehen. Für unsere Kunden und für unsere Geschäfts­prozesse – und damit für unseren Erfolg. Steigen Sie ein und nehmen Sie teil am Innovations­geschehen und der Digitalisierung in einer der großen deutschen Versicherungen. Wir freuen uns auf Sie. 


Diese Aufgaben erwarten Sie bei der HUK-COBURG:



  • Mitarbeit beim Aufbau eines unternehmensweiten Hadoop-basierten Data-Lake sowie unserer neuesten Telematik-Architekturen Kafka und Spark Streaming

  • Projektarbeit im Umfeld von Big-Data-Lösungen und erweiterten BI-Architektur-Fragestellungen, wie Virtual DWH und Data Federation

  • Bewertung neuer Technologien und Tools, wie z.B. im Kontext Data Science, und Methoden im Unternehmenskontext

  • Teamarbeit in einem motivierenden Team und Zusammenarbeit mit vielen weiteren Abteilungen und Projekten


Das bringen Sie mit:



  • Einen sehr guten Studienabschluss in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik oder einer ähnlichen Fachrichtung mit Bezug zu Data Science

  • Interesse an aktuellen Big-Data-Technologien und deren Einbettung in komplexe Systemlandschaften – idealerweise mit Berufserfahrung in diesem Umfeld

  • Freude an Komplexität und Gespür für die besten Lösungen

  • Organisationstalent – mit Willensstärke, Ergebnisorientierung und Weitblick

  • Eine eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise, die Kreativität und Engagement erfordert

  • Spaß an Kommunikation und persönlicher Weiterentwicklung

  • … und natürlich Faszination für das spannende Thema Business Intelligence

Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt!

As a Lead Data Scientist you manage the team creating data driven solutions to let Coolblue act smarter.

What you tell your friends at parties

"I automate Fortune telling, I predict the future."

What you really do


  • You build and lead a great team of Data Scientists.

  • You create Machine Learning services & Statistics & Data mining.

  • You promote Machine Learning, its architecture and the incredible advantages it could bring.

  • You help bring Data Science at Coolblue to the next level by delivering high performing scalable data driven solutions.

How you do it


  • By using your technical skills to closely collaborate with your team and take on the challenges of a rapidly growing e-commerce company.

  • By contributing to a solid data science infrastructure and selecting the right tools for the job.

  • By coaching and providing feedback to your team members.

  • By selecting and interviewing the best candidates for your team, together with our recruiters.

  • By working with the other leads on incorporating Data Science into the IT software development process.

A day at the office

Your day starts with a quick revision of our monitoring figures. You've spotted some unexpected figures and together with Peter you're going to take a closer look. Before the daily stand-up, you've discovered that the unexpected figures shouldn't negatively affect our operations. Even so, you decide to inform the team and create a story for your backlog.

After a coffee break, you pass by Giel, The Domain Boss. During the last 2 months, you've been assigned to the Pricing Domain. You have an appointment about the revision of the current price-elasticity estimation.

Whew, it’s already lunchtime. You have a walk outside with your team members and grab some food. After lunch, you work on testing some Regularized Regressions for predicting sales. Afterward, you summarize the results.

Time to relax. After a game of table tennis with your colleagues there is still one thing you have to do. You share your findings and results with the stakeholders before discussing a follow-up proposal with Matthias, Haseeb, and Madeleine (members of the Data Science Core team).

Team

You work with the other leads and managers of the IT Development department. Together you will define a solid IT Development strategy. Next to that you manage and coach the Data Scientists who work on IT Development projects. You promote knowledge sharing by example and take an active role in the bi-weekly internal Data Science meetup. Basically, your day is filled with making smart decisions smarter. 

What we're asking


  • A Master's degree (or PhD.) in Econometrics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics or another related field.

  • Relevant experience in a data-driven environment: leveraging analytics and large amounts of (streaming) data to drive significant business impact.

  • Expertise in Statistics & Data mining solutions and implementing Machine Learning services.

  • Prior experience in managing projects and seeing them through to completion (managerial experience is a huge plus).

  • Experience in writing and deploying robust, structured code within extended production environments (preferably Java, Scala, or Perl).

  • Experience in preparing scripts in languages like Python, R, Matlab, EViews, Julia, or Octave.
  • You lead the way with 'no ego, no fear & no politics' as core values to nurture autonomy within your data scientist teams.

  • You can’t stop smiling when you tell us about one of your pet projects.

What we're offering

 

  • Money.

  • Travel allowance and a pension plan.

  • Plenty of space for creativity.

  • Over 30 training courses at our own Coolblue University.

  • 25 leave days. As long as you'll promise to come back.

  • Discount on a new bicycle. Because that's how we roll.

  • Relocation assistance, from A to Z (if you live abroad).

  • An office at the best possible location. It's only a short stumble away from Rotterdam Central Station. Or a 2-minute walk.

  • Parties. All-night LAN.

Dans le cadre du développement de ses activités, autobiz recherche un(e) Data Scientist.


Membre de l’équipe Recherche et Développement, vous êtes responsable de la gestion et de l’analyse des données.


Pour ce faire, autobiz recherche des talents ambitieux, motivés à l’idée de rejoindre une société en pleine expansion, dans le secteur du digital et du big data.


Entreprise :


Créée en 2004, autobiz est une start-up innovante, leader sur le marché de la cotation automobile. L’analyse des données « big data » lui a permis de mettre en place une gamme d’outils internationaux pour développer le business VO (véhicule d’occasion) des professionnels de la distribution, de la location et de l’assurance automobile.  Elle se positionne également en pionnier de la reprise automobile via son site autobiz.fr, déclinée en Espagne et Italie.


Aujourd’hui basée à Suresnes (92), autobiz dispose également de bureaux à Berlin, à Valence (Espagne) et Milan. Membre de la communauté BPI Excellence, elle consacre chaque année 15% de son chiffre d’affaires à la R&D. Elle intervient notamment dans l’élaboration de programmes prédictifs dans le domaine de la transaction automobile en collaboration avec le laboratoire SAMM (Université Paris-Sorbonne). 


Début 2017, le groupe PSA a choisi d’entrer au capital d’autobiz avec une participation minoritaire. Cette décision stratégique fait d’autobiz un partenaire clé pour l’ambitieuse feuille de route « Push-to-pass » du groupe PSA, qui prévoit notamment un doublement de ses ventes mondiales de véhicules d’occasion à l’horizon 2020. autobiz et ses équipes sont pleinement associés à la réussite de cet objectif.


Pour plus d'informations : http://corporate.autobiz.com                                                                                                                                           


Poste et missions :


En qualité de Data Scientist, vous êtes responsable de la gestion et de l’analyse des données (big data).


Vos missions principales :



  1. Extraction, uniformisation et structuration des données



  • Collecter, sélectionner et valider les données clients pertinentes pour l’analyse

  • Définir les solutions de stockage et la structuration des données

  • Convertir, coder et cartographier des données de consommation ou d’usage produit dans un format compréhensible par l’ensemble des collaborateurs

  • Améliorer la qualité et enrichir les bases de données clients de l’entreprise

  • Déterminer les outils et méthodes d’acquisition de données depuis un ensemble de bases techniquement hétérogènes

  • Concevoir l’architecture d’un entrepôt de données décisionnelles

  • Maîtriser la qualité des données tout au long de leur traitement



  • Analyses prédictives et développement de la connaissance client



    • Mettre en œuvre et garantir la modélisation statistique des données

    • Développer des algorithmes d’apprentissage et scénarios prédictifs des comportements clients

    • Optimiser la segmentation client à l’aide des statistiques et données de consommation.

    • Étudier et mettre en place les meilleures solutions techniques pour gérer les grands volumes de données

    • Concevoir des modèles de détection des insights et des opportunités de marché

    • Accompagner l’entreprise dans le développement de leviers de création de valeur



  • Développement d’outils de support aux clients internes



    • Analyser l’ensemble des données commerciales pour développer des systèmes efficaces d’aide à la décision

    • Participer au développement des indicateurs de performance commerciale de l’entreprise

    • Fournir aux chefs de produit des leviers statistiques décisionnels pour la conduite et l’analyse des campagnes de prospection

    • Réaliser des études statistiques pour les clients internes ou la direction générale

    • Animer les ateliers d’expression des besoins internes et rédiger les cahiers des charges

    • Écrire et rédiger la spécification des besoins à destination des DSI ou de la maîtrise d’ouvrage

    • Déterminer les outils de reporting dynamique et multidimensionnel (OLAP)

    • Présenter les résultats des études réalisées aux clients internes

    • Former les utilisateurs aux outils informatiques et décisionnels



  • Veille technologique sur les outils de datamining



    • Effectuer une veille sur les nouvelles technologies et solutions logicielles d’analyse des données

    • Rechercher et expérimenter de nouvelles méthodes de modélisation et d’analyse des données

    • Sélectionner les nouveaux outils et techniques de data management


    Profil :


    De formation universitaire supérieure Bac+5 université (ex : Master en statistiques et marketing, informatique, statistique et informatique décisionnelle, économétrie) et ou Diplôme d’école d’ingénieurs, Doctorat en informatique, en mathématiques, …), vous êtes motivé(e) pour intégrer une structure à taille humaine en fort développement dans laquelle vous investir pleinement.


    Compétences :



    • Maitrise des algorithmes d’apprentissage automatique (Machine Learning)

    • Maitrise des outils de data management (Python, R)

    • Maîtrise des bases de données MariaDB

    • Très grande rigueur

    • Goût pour les données numériques et les chiffres

    • Sens des affaires pour détecter les opportunités et proposer des produits innovants

    • Qualité d’écoute afin de recueillir avec précision les informations et besoins des clients internes et externes.

As you know, SAP’s vision is to help the world run better and improve people’s lives.


As THE cloud company powered by SAP HANA®, SAP is a market leader in enterprise application software, helping companies of all sizes and industries Run Simple.


We empower people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. SAP applications and services enable our customers to operate profitably, adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.


At SAP, we believe in the power of collaboration and empower our employees to perform at their best in an environment that encourages free and open expression of ideas. Here, you work alongside creative thinkers who share your interests, while turning big ideas into reality for our customers. With innovative job training, mentors to help you grow, and the flexibility to balance your work and personal life, you’re able to build your career. It’s no wonder that some of the sharpest minds from around the world are working for a company that is consistently recognized as a global top employer.



As a Senior Data Scientist / Data Science Expert for the SAP Deep Learning Center of Excellence, you will work within a team of data engineers and developers solving real-world problems by building new, cloud based machine learning solutions and services. Our use cases span commerce, finance, procurement, logistics, and travel. You will work against fixed timelines and your success will be measured by the ability to deliver production-grade machine learning models reaching accuracies on par with top notch research prototypes.



EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS


Your tasks include:



  • Push the frontiers of what is possible in the area of Machine Learning working with real data

  • Explore, understand, and implement most recent machine learning algorithms and approaches

  • Comfortably handle very large data sets in scale-up and scale-out cloud environments

  • Fulfill both functional and non-functional (availability, throughput, latency) requirements

  • Understand business processes which create and consume data so as to be able to select best approaches, evaluate their performance, and asses business relevance

  • Create excellence both in terms of results quality and system scalability through continuous evaluation, analysis, and refinement

  • Communicate the relevance of implemented systems and achieved results in a visual and consistent way



EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES


You are a self-starter, goal-oriented, striving for perfection engineer. As an ideal candidate, you will demonstrate a proven track record in development of large-scale machine learning pipelines and combine it with curiosity for exploring of new use cases and applications of machine learning to domains spanning processing of structured and unstructured data.



Required skills & qualifications:



  • Master degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Physics or related field

  • Track record of developing productive machine learning-based solutions and/or systems

  • Proficiency in working with very large datasets in distributed Linux/Unix environments

  • Experience with Python and Machine Learning software packages such as scikit-learn or TensorFlow 

  • Experience with data and error analysis and ability to present core insights in a clear and compelling way

  • Team spirit and desire to overcome obstacles and make your work benefit SAP's customers

  • Excellent English language skills



WORK EXPERIENCE


At least 5 years of relevant experience in deep learning / machine learning / data science development projects with a focus on innovation.



LOCATION


Berlin area, Germany



EXPECTED TRAVEL


0 - 30%


The position can be filled as part time position.



SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT 



To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

Sie werden Teil unseres sehr engagierten und kollaborativen Advanced-Analytics-Teams und beschäftigen sich mit spannenden Projekten aus allen Branchen. Wir arbeiten eng mit Klienten und Content-Experten zusammen, um Analytics-Lösungen, -Expertise und -Fähigkeiten in die Organisation unserer Klienten einzubetten. Durch die Kombination von strategischen und Business Insights mit den neuesten analytischen Techniken helfen wir unseren Klienten, aus Daten maximalen Nutzen zu ziehen und kritische Probleme datengetrieben zu lösen.


Ihre Aufgabe:


Sie entwickeln als Spezialist mit Hilfe von Advanced-Analytics-Methoden Lösungen für die herausfordernden Problemstellungen unserer Klienten – von der Konzeption über die Modellbildung bis zur Übergabe in die Implementierung.


Dabei verwenden Sie Ihre Kenntnisse in Mathematik, Statistik, Machine Learning oder Optimierung, um für und mit unseren Klienten aus den verschiedensten Branchen wichtige Erkenntnisse abzuleiten. In interdisziplinären Teams, bestehend aus Beratern, Experten und Data Scientists, bringen Sie Ihre Expertise ein. Sie arbeiten vor Ort bei Klienten in Deutschland, Europa und optional weltweit und kommunizieren Ihre Lösungen sowohl im Team als auch gegenüber den Klienten.


Ihr Profil:



  • Masterabschluss oder Promotion im Bereich (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik, Statistik, Machine Learning, Physik, Operations Research, Informatik oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet

  • Sichere Kommunikation in deutscher und englischer Sprache

  • Präsentations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, insbesondere die Fähigkeit, komplexe analytische Konzepte für Fachfremde und Experten anderer Gebiete nachvollziehbar zu erläutern

  • Erfahrung in einem der folgenden Gebiete: statistische Modellierung, Machine Learning, mathematische Optimierung oder Prozesssimulation

  • Erste praktische Erfahrung bei der Anwendung fortgeschrittener Data-Science-Methoden an Echtdaten im Businesskontext

  • Sichere Beherrschung zweier Programmiersprachen (z.B. R, Python, Julia, SQL, GMPL, GAMS, ILOG OPL oder verwandte Sprachen)

  • Kenntnisse einiger typischer Frameworks, z.B. mlr, caret, NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, Spark ML, Keras, TensorFlow, Theano oder gurobipy

  • Ergänzend Erfahrung in der Anwendung von Gradient Boosting, Support Vector Machines bzw. Neural Networks, Deep Learning oder alternativ im Formulieren und Lösen von Optimierungsproblemen mit Gurobi, CPLEX oder CBC bzw. in der Anwendung von Simulationssoftware wie AnyLogic oder Arena

  • Idealerweise zusätzlich Kenntnisse in Big-Data-Infrastruktur und Cloud-basierten Analyseinstrumenten wie AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Spark, Hadoop, AMLS oder BigQuery


Was wir bieten:



  • Sie erfahren persönlich die vielfältigen, branchenübergreifenden Einsatzmöglichkeiten von Advanced Analytics.

  • Sie werden Teil unseres internationalen Teams an Standorten weltweit und in unserem Advanced Analytics Hub in Düsseldorf.

  • Sie nutzen die Vorteile der Kombination aus Einarbeitung und Unterstützung durch erfahrene Kollegen und einem gleichzeitig stark wachsenden jungen Team.

  • Sie profitieren von einem inspirierenden und kollegialen Umfeld, das hoch qualifizierte Mitarbeiter aus den Bereichen Mathematik, Physik, Statistik, Informatik und Ingenieurwesen vereint.

  • Sie bleiben auf der Höhe der neuesten Entwicklungen durch regelmäßigen interna­tionalen Ideenaustausch, Trainings, die Teilnahme an internationalen Konferenzen und starke Verbindungen zur akademischen Welt.

Careem is a leading ride sharing app operational in over 80+ cities. With 30% monthly growth, we are one of the fastest growing companies in our region. Our recipe for success has been a team that thrives on challenges and is passionate about solving problems.  After our recent investment of $500m, we are now the 180th unicorn globally and scaling at the speed of lightning


We like to describe Careem as the "data science paradise", as we are working on most of the data science problems one can encounter. We also have tremendous data whealth and diversity, from CSV files that can fit in your R consol, to Terrabytes of data.


ABOUT THE ROLE


As a Senior/Lead Data Scientist at Careem, you'll be part of a team that's leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale. You will be developing descriptive and predictive models as well as running extensive data analysis on million of customer transactions supported by a cutting edge data platform to unlock the big opportunities that simplify the lives of people through reliable transportation


In the process, you will:



  • Answer complex analytic questions from big data sets to help Careem shape its products and services in a better way.

  • Implement strong data pipelines for Machine Learning algorithms that will be used in production

  • Implement large scale machine learning algorithm.

  • Exploratory Data Analysis experience.

  • Design, implement and support ETLs/ELTs to process terabytes of data each week.

  • Embark on exploratory data analysis projects to achieve better understanding of phenomena as well as to discover untapped areas of growth and optimization.

  • Help define and track the appropriate key metrics for specific projects.

  • Design and run randomized controlled experiments, analyze the resulting data and communicate results with other teams,

  • You will always challenge the status quo and continually investigate new data processing technologies and seek to ensure that we follow the industry best practices.


The ideal candidate will have a passionate commitment to improving the lives of people, an insane focus on excellence and customer service, and a strong alignment with our core values: being bold, focused, agile and collaborative.

FindHotel is looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help us push our data driven organisation to even higher levels. We are looking for someone with a strong academic and/or business background in machine learning, statistics and programming, and with a keen interest in applying machine learning to real business problems.  The Data Scientist will be leading a variety of projects that aim to automate decision making in core business processes.


What you'll be doing:


Use historical data to build accurate models of KPIs for our performance-based marketing campaigns: customer value, competition, etc.


Optimize the targeting and pricing of our SEM campaigns. 


Use Machine Learning to make our website as effective as possible: e.g. by providing visitors the recommendations that are most relevant to them.


Closely collaborate with our developers in the deployment of data science products to our production systems. 


Continuously research new data sources, methods and technologies.
 


What a day in the office might look like:


In our daily standup our analysts have mentioned that European travelers tend to make more expensive bookings when traveling far away from home.  They also seem to have a preference for hotels with certain features (e.g. free Wifi, on-site parking, etc). However, data is very scarce and the analysts don't know whether these findings can be used to optimize our European Adwords campaigns. Considering the scale of the European market, any minor optimization in our campaigns can have a great impact in the business, so you decide to take a closer look. You start the morning by getting a relevant historical dataset from our data warehouse, cleaning it, and preparing it for exploration with your favourite tools.  After your morning exploration on the you data, you end up with a list of data manipulation and modelling approaches that you think could lead to specific improvements in our campaigns. You will then spend the rest of the afternoon setting up a simple model validation framework that will allow you short list your most promising ideas, so that you can focus on optimizing only those in the following days.


The squad:


You will be working with a multidisciplinary squad of analysts, data scientists and engineers, and a product owner.


Why join now?



  • We have completely re-built  the internals of our product and set the foundations to transform FindHotel from a search product into a recommendation system. This transition will obviously be driven by data and will bring exciting data engineering and data science challenges.

  • We are looking to grow traffic from 2M monthly visitors to +10M within the coming year. Doing that in a market as mature and competitive as online accommodation means that we need to be truly innovative. If you have a great idea nobody will stop you from giving it a try!

  • We have just built a tool that allows us to scale our Search Marketing Campaigns to a completely new level. This means massive datasets and unique challenges in terms of data science, engineering and automation.

  • We have formed a solid team of two data scientists and two data engineers and we are looking to grow the team considerably in the near future. You will have the chance to grow with us.

Polecat helps companies extract intelligence from large volumes of unstructured data to help them make better decisions. We're a small team working on a new, ambitious product and we'd like to add additional Software Engineers to accelerate our progress.


The product is designed to help companies understand and manage their online reputation, providing actionable intelligence from unstructured data. We gather huge volumes of data from online and broadcast media, social networks, discussion forums and many other sources and enrich it to discover the companies, people, topics, events and relationships. We analyse this data to identify themes, trends and relationships, helping our customers understand and manage their digital footprint. They can then measure their reputation performance and identify potential problems they need to address. We do this for some of the largest companies in the world, and are now developing the next generation of our platform and products.


The opportunity is enormous, for this product and others we have planned. The fundamental capability of tracking reputation in real time is extremely valuable to companies. Some 28 percent of a UK company's value is accounted for by reputation, according to the small and mid-cap sentiment index, compiled by the Quoted Companies Alliance and accountancy firm BDO. To keep up the momentum on new features and be able to respond rapidly to new market knowledge and feedback, we need more engineers on the team.


As a Polecat Software Engineer you'll be able to contribute within the team from day one. We tackle product missions together, sharing context, proposing hypotheses and looking for the fastest way to a solution that demonstrably succeeds. We aim for metric-driven decisions and iteration to achieve outcomes. We'll help you develop knowledge of our systems and where the boundaries of feasibility lie. We'll collaborate on design and planning and you'll work alongside other engineers to build solutions, pairing or not as makes sense. In common with the rest of the team, you'll be expected to both play to your strengths (making the most of previous experience for instance) but also be prepared to pick up the tasks furthest from your comfort zone when that's what's required to help the team move forwards on a given day.


New technology features strongly in our recent work - whatever gets us the best outcome quickly. Some of the technologies we've introduced recently include Clojure, Elasticsearch, Kafka (including Kafka Streams) and React with most-js - however part of the role is to help us evolve rapidly and use the right tools at the right times, so the technologies are likely to change over time. We have a mix of frontend- and backend-focused staff on the team but we'd like to add people who are happy to work across either.


You'll work on data processing logic running under stream processing frameworks; data indexing and retrieval services; backends that support our frontends and the frontend products themselves; plus APIs for internal consumption and for partner access. At present backends are a mixture of Clojure and Java and most recent frontend projects are React-based. We have an internal mission to create a great environment for technology experimentation within the company.


Working for Polecat you'll work with nice, smart people with chances to socialise regularly and an annual whole-company conference. You'll benefit from significant work flexibility but also a great office location in Bristol. You'll be able to follow your interests and influence how things work. You'll find big ideas are welcomed and be surprised by how fast the company evolves.



When we interview you, there are some specifics we'll be looking for.


You care about and drive outcomes. This means you ensure you understand what we're trying to achieve and look beyond simply writing code to understand the big picture and make good judgements about exactly which quality attributes are important for a piece of work. As a software engineer you should be accountable to outcomes of software change, not lines of code written or unit test coverage.


You're well-practised at proposing ideas. Creativity is a skill and requires practice. We're looking for people who will contribute and indeed advocate for their own ideas or equally will get behind ideas from others.


You work well in a collaborative environment. Good collaboration requires good communication, openness, compromise, courage, trust and respect. You'll be able to talk about plenty of examples of all of those behaviours.


You're not fazed by tough problems. We hit plenty of difficult issues and can't afford to get stuck. There's always a way around, but you'll need to demonstrate the tenacity, systems thinking and creativity needed to find it.


You believe the team comes first. You understand deeply and intuitively that we'll achieve more if we work together. You'll prioritise helping a team-mate over your own individual box-ticking.


You believe there's always room for improvement. You'll always be teaching yourself new skills and you'll demand opportunities to continue that learning at work. You'll apply the same instinct to continuous improvement to your work and the processes that affect it, looking for ways to increase automation and reduce waste.


Technical skills: To get on well with our more recent codebases, you are going to need a good understanding of functional programming and ideally either Clojure or Ramda (or both, or at least something similar and the will to learn). Other language experience that would be relevant are F#, Haskell, Scala, Java 8, ES6. Reactive programming would give you a head-start on our frontend codebase - rx-js, most, cycle-js, redux.


We will expect applicants to be familiar with modern SCM tools, ideally git. You should be practised in writing different categories of tests and know the difference. Using a continuous build server should be a no-brainer. You can expect peer reviews of code changes as a normal workflow.


If you've worked with stream processing before (e.g. Apache Storm, Kafka Streams, Onyx) that would be very useful. Other technologies that would be relevant are Elasticsearch and Solr, Spark, Jenkins, Ansible, WSO2.


There are also a bunch of things that would be interesting to know about when you apply. Any experience with data processing, working with data scientists, machine learning, natural language processing, information retrieval or data visualisation would be very useful. If you've worked on product innovation teams before that would help and any exposure to lean methodology and continuous deployment would be great.

  • Experience of building software that is being used by real customers

  • At least a year's experience with one of the programming languages / environments mentioned above
